slides.title: Introduction to HTML5
slides.content:
# HTML5 Revolution üöÄ

HTML5 is the latest major version of HTML. It introduced new elements, attributes, and behaviors to make the web more powerful.

## Key Improvements

- **Semantic Elements:** Standardized tags for layout (header, footer, nav).
- **Multimedia:** Native support for audio and video.
- **Graphics:** 1080p graphics with SVG and Canvas.
- **Storage:** Local Storage replaces cookies for larger data.

Let's explore the semantic structure first!

slides.title: Semantic Elements
slides.content:
# Semantic Elements üèóÔ∏è

A **semantic element** clearly describes its meaning to both the browser and the developer.

**Non-semantic:** `<div>`, `<span>` - Tells nothing about its content.
**Semantic:** `<form>`, `<table>`, `<article>` - Clearly defines its content.

HTML5 introduced new semantic layout tags:
- `<header>`
- `<nav>`
- `<section>`
- `<article>`
- `<aside>`
- `<footer>`

> üîç **Why use them?** Better SEO and Accessibility!

slides.title: HTML5 Video
slides.content:
# HTML5 Video üé¨

Before HTML5, videos could only be played with plugins (like Flash). The `<video>` element specifies a standard way to embed a video.

## Syntax

```html
<video width="320" height="240" controls>
  <source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  <source src="movie.ogg" type="video/ogg">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
```

- `controls`: Adds play, pause, and volume buttons.
- `autoplay`: Starts playing automatically.
- `loop`: Restarts the video when finished.

slides.title: The <canvas> Element
SVG Graphics
slides.content:
# SVG Graphics üìê

**SVG** stands for Scalable Vector Graphics.

- Used to define vector-based graphics for the Web.
- Defined in XML format.
- Do not lose quality when zoomed or resized.

```html
<svg width="100" height="100">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" />
</svg>
```

Unlike Canvas (which is pixel-based), SVG is resolution-independent.

slides.title: HTML5 Geolocation
slides.content:
# Geolocation API üåç

The HTML Geolocation API is used to locate a user's position.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Privacy:** Since this can compromise privacy, the position is not available unless the user approves it.

```javascript
navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(successCallback, errorCallback);
```

Commonly used for maps and location-specific content.

slides.title: Drag and Drop
Summary
slides.content:
# Summary üåü

HTML5 modernized the web!

## Key Takeaways

- ‚úÖ **Semantic Tags** (header, nav, article) describe structure better.
- ‚úÖ **<video> and <audio>** allow native media playback.
- ‚úÖ **<canvas>** enables drawing graphics via JS.
- ‚úÖ **SVG** offers scalable vector images.
- ‚úÖ **APIs** like Geolocation and Drag & Drop add rich functionality.

Use these features to build modern, accessible, and interactive applications!
